intro: Geonoma ferruginea subsp. microspadix, commonly known as the rusty bract fern, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive rusty-colored midrib, which gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
